title: Hook function in Linux SO file
content:
I'm working on reverse engineering an Android application where the native code opens TLS connections using a built-in copy of mbedtls with certificate pinning. I'd like to decrypt that traffic and log it.

Normally, I would use LD_PRELOAD. In this case I cannot because mbedtls is embedded in the same dynamic library it is being called from, so traditional PLT/GOT hookers won't do.

comments.text: AFAIK frida.re should solve the problem
It doesn't, frida.re appears to use the same PLT/GOT hooking technique.
